page.title: 11Winter - LONGTON PANTOMIME
page.content: In January Longton S.Andrew's Church plays host to the village{Pantomime. All the parts are played by local people including a Doctor, bank manager and the Vicar. The chorus are schoolgirls and the Tinies are aged 5 or 6. The 1986 panto.is BABES IN THE WOOD.and is performed in the church Hall, opening with a charity evening on Thurs. Public shows Friday, Sat(matinee & evening). The next week it plays again Th. Fr.Sat.They usually perform to full houses,so some 1200 people come to see the show.Young children are seated at the front,and really enjoy reacting to the different characters.Hiss at the villains; Argue with the brokers men; cheering the hero or heroine. After the final curtain the cast hold a celebration party. Many of the cast do their party pieces or give parodies of the show.
